text: Phase 3: Sugar oxidation and ATP formation — Six steps involved, with two major events (a) Each 3-carbon fragment is oxidized by removal of a pair of H, which is picked up by NAD*, forming reduced NADH + H* — H carries a portion of glucose’s energy (b) Inorganic phosphate groups (P,) are then attached to each oxidized fragment — Cleavage of these phosphate groups from both fragments will result in formation of 2 pyruvic acid and 4 ATPs by substrate-level phosphorylation
